clinical_study.brief_title: Wounds Protocol at Family Health Strategy Units in a Rio Grande do Sul Countryside Town
clinical_study.official_title: Implementing and Assessing an Wounds Protocol at Family Health Strategy Units in a Rio Grande do Sul Countryside Town

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate the process for implementing a wound protocol for lesion control and cost-effectiveness in the context of the Family Health Strategy in the city of Santa Cruz do Sul, Brazil.

primary_outcome.measure: Lesion remission by measuring the surface area of the wound
primary_outcome.description: Remission of the wound, and other clinical variables such as odor, pain, infection and presence of exudate.

arm_group.description: This group comprises 6 healthcare units equipped with a Family Health Strategy, where patients are seen by coordinating nurses who have been trained to use wound dressing supplies and also on the use of the protocol.

This group comprising 5 healthcare units equipped with a Family Health Strategy. Patients were seen by coordinating nurses who used techniques and supplies with which they were already familiar. They had no protocol in place.

intervention.description: Nurses who have been trained to use wound dressing supplies and also on the use of the protocol.
